column4: anyone else have problems running   gksudo "update-manager -c -d"   ?  i get dbus error
you shouldn't need both the -c and -d at the same time, but I can't imagine that's the source of the error
which guide?
the one linked off digg a few days ago
Right.  Sounds like a bad idea.  Follow the official ones: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UpgradeNotes
I'd link you to the page further, but have no idea which one you're upgrading to ;)
ok i'll try that
i'll read it and then let you know if i run into problems =D
actually, you should probably ask in #ubuntu+1, since that's the Feisty channel for another week.
-c is only needed when upgrading from LTS releases.  -d is for development, so if you, say, wanted the current feisty
Dapper is an LTS.  Dapper won't nag you about edgy being out without the -c
i did gksudo update-manager -c  but it jsut times out
-d not -c
trying -d
i get this error. warning: could not initiate dbus
never
darn :|
You can de-DRM them if you have OSX or windows and itunes.  Then you'll have them.  Check out Hymn (its on sourceforge, I believe)
Hymn
#ubuntu+1 for Hardy Intrepid support, thanks.
any reason you told ubottu to PM me about my away message?
Your nick changes when you're away (goose|zZz), If you have an away message above that, we have no qualms with that.
Please don't be malicious
